summary: A complaint email from Adrian Praljak to the Royal Commission Chair Ronald Sackville, alleging serious misconduct by solicitor Alexander Andrew Tees, including failure to pay wages, misuse of client money, threats, and exploitation of young lawyers. The complainant seeks assistance due to financial hardship and disability preventing court action.

persons.name: Adrian Praljak
persons.context: Author of the complaint email, alleging he was exploited and not paid for work performed for Alexander Andrew Tees from April 2016 to September 2017.

persons.name: Ronald Sackville
persons.context: Recipient of the complaint email, addressed as "The Hon Ronald Sackville AO QC Chair of the Royal Commission."

persons.name: Alexander Andrew Tees
persons.context: Solicitor accused by Adrian Praljak of failing to pay wages, misusing client money, making threats, providing incorrect advice, and exploiting young lawyers.

persons.name: Shiva Amiri
persons.context: Mentioned as the complainant's former girlfriend about whom Alexander Andrew Tees allegedly gave incorrect advice.

persons.name: Leanne Tacey
persons.context: Solicitor who attempted to take Alexander Andrew Tees to the Fair Work Commission on behalf of Adrian Praljak in 2019, but the case was closed when Tees failed to appear.

connections.description: Praljak worked as a full-time solicitor for Tees from April 2016 to September 2017, and alleges Tees failed to pay his salary and bonuses.
Shiva Amiri is identified as Praljak's former girlfriend.
Leanne Tacey, a solicitor, attempted to represent Praljak in a Fair Work Commission case against Alexander Andrew Tees.
Tacey attempted to bring a Fair Work Commission case against Tees on behalf of Praljak.

events.title: Praljak's Employment with Tees
events.description: Adrian Praljak worked as a full-time solicitor for Alexander Andrew Tees during this period, for which he claims he was never paid.

events.title: Fair Work Commission Case Attempt
events.description: Solicitor Leanne Tacey attempted to take Alexander Andrew Tees to the Fair Work Commission in Brisbane on behalf of Adrian Praljak. The case was closed when Tees failed to appear for two scheduled hearings.

events.title: Complaint to Royal Commission
events.description: Adrian Praljak sent an urgent, confidential complaint email to Royal Commission Chair Ronald Sackville detailing allegations against Alexander Andrew Tees.

keyFacts: Adrian Praljak alleges Alexander Andrew Tees owes him between $180,000 and $250,000 in unpaid salary and bonuses for 1.7 years of work, plus $59,000 in unreimbursed expenses incurred by his mother.
Praljak claims Tees has misused client money, made serious threats, provided incorrect legal advice, and exploited many other young lawyers nationally and internationally.
A prior attempt to seek recourse via the Fair Work Commission in 2019 failed because Alexander Andrew Tees did not appear for the scheduled hearings.
Praljak states he is unable to pursue Federal Court action due to financial hardship and a total permanent disability (Vertigo & Acrophobia) that prevents him from attending court hearings.
The complaint has been referred to the Queensland Law Society and Queensland Police, and Praljak is seeking the Royal Commission's assistance to obtain financial compensation and other remedies.
